member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.StorageBase.peekedTransmissions
member.summary: Peeked transmissions dictionary (maps file name to its full path). Holds all the transmissions that were peeked.
member.remarks: Note: The value (=file's full path) is not required in the Storage implementation. If there was a concurrent Abstract Data Type Set it would have been used instead. However, since there is no concurrent Set, dictionary is used and the second value is ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.StorageBase.CapacityInBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the storage in bytes. When limit is reached, the Enqueue method will drop new transmissions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.StorageBase.MaxFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of files. When limit is reached, the Enqueue method will drop new transmissions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Storage.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A folder name. Under this folder all the transmissions will be saved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Storage.Peek
member.summary: Reads an item from the storage. Order is Last-In-First-Out. When the Transmission is no longer needed (it was either sent or failed with a non-retriable error) it should be disposed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Storage.GetFiles(Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery,System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Get files from .
member.param: Define the logic for sorting the files.
Defines a file extension. This method will return only files with this extension.
Define how many files to return. This can be useful when the directory has a lot of files, in that case GetFilesAsync will have a performance hit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Storage.GetSizeAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile)
member.summary: Gets a file's size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Storage.CalculateSizeAsync
member.summary: Check the storage limits and return true if they reached. Storage limits are defined by the number of files and the total size on disk.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Storage.DeleteObsoleteFiles
member.summary: Enqueue is saving a transmission to a tmp file and after a successful write operation it renames it to a trn file. A file without a trn extension is ignored by Storage.Peek(), so if a process is taken down before rename happens it will stay on the disk forever. This thread deletes files with the tmp extension that exists on disk for more than 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Storage.FolderName
member.summary: Gets the storage's folder name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Storage.StorageFolder
member.summary: Gets the storage folder.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager
member.summary: This class handles all the logic for flushing the In Memory buffer to the persistent storage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.telemetryBuffer
member.summary: The memory buffer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.flushWaitHandle
member.summary: A wait handle that signals when a flush is required.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.storage
member.summary: The storage that is used to persist all the transmissions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.disposeCount
member.summary: The number of times this object was disposed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.flushLoopEnabled
member.summary: A boolean value that determines if the long running thread that runs flush in a loop will stay alive.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.#ctor(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.StorageBase,Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.TelemetryBuffer,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The storage that persists the telemetries.
In memory buffer that holds telemetries.
A boolean value that determines if flush will happen automatically. Used by unit tests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.Flush
member.summary: Persist the in-memory telemetry items.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.FlushLoop
member.summary: Flushes in intervals set by .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.OnTelemetryBufferFull
member.summary: Handles the full event coming from the TelemetryBuffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.FlushDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum telemetry batching interval. Once the interval expires, persists the accumulated telemetry items.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.FlushManager.EndpointAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the service endpoint.
member.remarks: Q: Why flushManager knows about the endpoint? A: Storage stores objects and Transmission objects contain the endpoint address.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel
member.summary: Represents a communication channel for sending telemetry to Application Insights via HTTPS.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A folder name. Under this folder all the transmissions will be saved. Setting this value groups channels, even from different processes. If 2 (or more) channels has the same storageFolderName only one channel will perform the sending even if the channel is in a different process/AppDomain/Thread.

Defines the number of senders. A sender is a long-running thread that sends telemetry batches in intervals defined by . So the amount of senders also defined the maximum amount of http channels opened at the same time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.Dispose
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.Send(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.ITelemetry)
member.summary: Sends an instance of ITelemetry through the channel.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the in-memory buffer to disk.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.StorageUniqueFolder
member.summary: Gets the storage unique folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.DeveloperMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether developer mode of telemetry transmission is enabled. When developer mode is True, sends telemetry to Application Insights immediately during the entire lifetime of the application. When developer mode is False, respects production sending policies defined by other properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.SendingInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets an interval between each successful sending.
member.remarks: On error scenario this value is ignored and the interval will be defined using an exponential back-off algorithm.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.FlushInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between each flush to disk.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.EndpointAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP address where the telemetry is sent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.MaxTelemetryBufferCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of telemetry items that will accumulate in a memory before persists them to disk.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.MaxTransmissionStorageCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of disk space, in bytes, that will use for storage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.MaxTransmissionStorageFilesCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of files allowed in storage. When the limit is reached telemetries will be dropped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.StopUploadAfterIntervalInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time, in seconds, after application is started when the will send telemetry to ApplicationInsights. Once the specified amount of time runs out, telemetry will be stored on disk until the application is started again.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.DataUploadIntervalInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum telemetry batching interval. Once the interval expires, persists the accumulated telemetry items.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.MaxTransmissionBufferCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory, in bytes, that will use to buffer transmissions before sending them to Application Insights.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceChannel.MaxTransmissionSenderCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of telemetry transmissions that will send to Application Insights at the same time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter
member.summary: Implements throttled and persisted transmission of telemetry to Application Insights.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.senders
member.summary: A list of senders that sends transmissions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.storage
member.summary: The storage that is used to persist all the transmissions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.sendingCancellationTokenSource
member.summary: Cancels the sending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.mutex
member.summary: A mutex that will be used as a name mutex to synchronize transmitters even from different processes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.disposeCount
member.summary: The number of times this object was disposed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.eventToKeepMutexThreadAlive
member.summary: Mutex is released once the thread that acquired it is ended. This event keeps the long running thread that acquire the mutex alive until dispose is called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.#ctor(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.StorageBase,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The transmissions storage.
The number of senders to create.
A boolean value that indicates if this class should try and create senders. This is a workaround for unit tests purposes only.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.SendForDeveloperMode(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.ITelemetry,System.String)
member.summary: Sending the item to the endpoint immediately without persistence.
member.param: Telemetry item.
Server endpoint address.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.AcquireMutex(System.Action)
member.summary: Make sure that happens only once even if it is executed on different processes. On every given time only one channel will acquire the mutex, even if the channel is on a different process. This method is using a named mutex to achieve that. Once the mutex is acquired will be executed.
member.param: The action to perform once the mutex is acquired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.CreateSenders(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create senders to send telemetries.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.StopSenders
member.summary: Stops the senders.
member.remarks: As long as there is no Start implementation, this method should only be called from Dispose.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.StorageUniqueFolder
member.summary: Gets a unique folder name. This folder will be used to store the transmission files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter.SendingInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between each successful sending.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender
member.summary: Fetch transmissions from the storage and sends it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.DelayHandler
member.summary: A wait handle that flags the sender when to start sending again. The type is protected for unit test.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.sendingIntervalOnNoData
member.summary: When storage is empty it will be queried again after this interval.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.maxIntervalBetweenRetries
member.summary: Holds the maximum time for the exponential back-off algorithm. The sending interval will grow on every HTTP Exception until this max value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.stoppedHandler
member.summary: A wait handle that is being set when Sender is no longer sending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.defaultSendingInterval
member.summary: The default sending interval.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.stopped
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates if the sender should be stopped. The sender's while loop is checking this boolean value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.drainingTimeout
member.summary: The amount of time to wait, in the stop method, until the last transmission is sent. If time expires, the stop method will return even if the transmission hasn't been sent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.storage
member.summary: The transmissions storage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.disposeCount
member.summary: The number of times this object was disposed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.transmitter
member.summary: Holds the transmitter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.#ctor(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.StorageBase,Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.PersistenceTransmitter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The storage that holds the transmissions to send.
The persistence transmitter that manages this Sender. The transmitter will be used as a configuration class, it exposes properties like SendingInterval that will be read by Sender.
A boolean value that determines if Sender should start sending immediately. This is only used for unit tests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the managed objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.StopAsync
member.summary: Stops the sender.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.SendLoop
member.summary: Send transmissions in a loop.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.Send(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.StorageTransmission,System.TimeSpan@)
member.summary: Sends a transmission and handle errors.
member.param: The transmission to send.
When this value returns it will hold a recommendation for when to start the next sending iteration.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if there was a retriable error.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.LogInterval(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Log next interval. Only log the interval when it changes by more then a minute. So if interval grow by 1 minute or decreased by 1 minute it will be logged. Logging every interval will just make the log noisy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.GetStatusCode(System.Net.WebException)
member.summary: Return the status code from the web exception or null if no such code exists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.IsRetryable(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Net.WebExceptionStatus)
member.summary: Returns true if or are retriable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.CalculateNextInterval(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Calculates the next interval using exponential back-off algorithm (with the exceptions of few error codes that reset the interval to .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Sender.SendingInterval
member.summary: Gets the interval between each successful sending.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.StorageTransmission.Dispose
member.summary: Disposing the storage transmission.

member.summary: Creates a new transmission from the specified .
